alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 10 at 3:25PM EST until December 10 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EST FOR CENTRAL WAKE AND SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 325 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Raleigh, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Wake Forest, Garner, Zebulon, Bunn, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, and Youngsville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for central North Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
